channel.title: R on PhyloTips: Tips for those using phylogenies in their work
channel.description: Recent content in R on PhyloTips: Tips for those using phylogenies in their work

item.title: My ultrametric tree is not ultrametric
item.description: Getting a tree with branch lengths proportional to time is a key step for many methods. With NSF’s generous assistance, we’re working on methods to make this easier (the Datelife.org website, the datelife R package), but one can look for chronograms at TreeBase and Open Tree of Life, or even make your own using r8s, treepl, Beast, RevBayes, or more. The convention in phylogenetics is to call trees with equal root to tip lengths “ultrametric.
